greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Divide each side of a triangle into 2*n-1 (n>=1) equal parts and trace the corresponding cevians, i.e., join every point, except for the first and last ones, with the opposite vertex. a(n) is the number of points at which three cevians meet.
mathematica: CevIntersections[n_] := Length[Solve[(n - i)*(n - j)*(n - k) - i*j*k == 0 && 0 < i < n &&  0 < j < n && 0 < k < n, {i, j, k}, Integers]];
results.author: _César Eliud Lozada_, Jan 16 2020
